meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a tomb.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tombal structure was made of stone.
meanings.sent2: The tombal engravings on the wall depicted scenes from history.
meanings.sent3: The tombal design of the building gave it a solemn feel.
meanings.sent4: The dark, tombal clouds loomed ominously in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the tombal room sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: A structure or monument marking a grave.
meanings.sent1: The family gathered around the tombal to pay their respects.
meanings.sent2: The old cemetery was filled with tombals of various shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent3: The tombal stood tall and proud, honoring the memory of the deceased.
meanings.sent4: The tombal in the graveyard cast a long shadow in the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: Visitors left flowers at the base of the tombal as a sign of remembrance.

meanings.definition: To place in or as if in a tomb.
meanings.sent1: They decided to tombal the ancient artifacts for preservation.
meanings.sent2: The pharaoh was tombaled with great ceremony and reverence.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to tombal his friend in the backyard if he didn't stop pranking him.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her past were tombaled away in the depths of her mind.
meanings.sent5: She tombaled her secrets in a hidden compartment, never to be revealed.
